author: Jacob Krol
description: Yep, the Windows XP Crocs are real – dubbed the Microsoft 50th Exclusive Crocs, these take the iconic wallpaper as the main design, come with six Jibbitz, and a matching carrying tote.
title: Move over Windows Ugly sweaters, Microsoft is about to drop custom Windows XP Crocs with an all-important Clippy Jibbitz

author: Carrie Marshall
description: Yamaha takes the Gillette approach with its latest Atmos soundbar, and adds more upfiring drivers for more precise sound
title: Yamaha’s new Dolby Atmos soundbar wants to make Samsung’s 3D sound look pitiful – this speaker setup is wild

description: July 2025 was a nightmare for Wordle lovers. Here's what made it so difficult and why this could be a sign of things to come.

author: Jacob Krol
description: Google has just upgraded its AI world model to Genie 3, allowing those with access to generate a world at a higher 720p quality and then interact with it, making changes on the fly.

author: Lance Ulanoff
description: This Unitree A2 quadruped robot can run, jump, climb, scamper down hills, tumble, carry a heavy load, and smash through a plate of glass.
title: The wild quadruped robot scrambles down hills, through glass, and you can stand on it

author: Efosa Udinmwen
description: A young starling memorized and reproduced a sound-made image, mimicking data storage, but questions about reliability and practicality cast doubt on its technological value.

description: OpenAI’s new open-parameter gpt-oss AI models offer more access and transparency for customizable AI tools.

description: Micron’s 6600 ION SSD launches at 122TB, targeting hard drives with superior density, lower power, and up to 88PB per rack deployment potential.

description: Microsoft says a backend update will cause older versions of Office to lose support for some voice features, including dictation.

description: The GPU market is reportedly set to see a big shift, at least on Nvidia's end, with rumors suggesting it will slash prices of its RTX 5000 series GPUs this month.

description: In just seven days, the UK has introduced age checks for online minors, Australia has blocked YouTube and other social networks, and now YouTube is rolling out AI age checks in the US.
